com.luigisgro.cqf.montecarlo
Class MonteCarloSimulation<T extends TimePoint>

java.lang.Object
  com.luigisgro.cqf.montecarlo.MonteCarloSimulation<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public class MonteCarloSimulation<T extends TimePoint>
extends java.lang.Object

Skeleton of a Monte Carlo simulation. It implements the logic for creating scenarios based on a MultiFactorModel and running iteratively until the MonteCarloEvaluator provided doesn't stop the process

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Constructor Summary
MonteCarloSimulation(MultiFactorModel multiFactorModel, MonteCarloEvaluator<T> evaluator, RandomVectorGenerator randomVectorGenerator, Curve baseScenario, T[] pointDates, double timeStep)
          Creates a new Monte Carlo simulation framework
 
Method Summary
 int simulate()
          This method executes a complete Monte Carlo simulation.

Constructor Detail

MonteCarloSimulation

public MonteCarloSimulation(MultiFactorModel multiFactorModel,
                            MonteCarloEvaluator<T> evaluator,
                            RandomVectorGenerator randomVectorGenerator,
                            Curve baseScenario,
                            T[] pointDates,
                            double timeStep)
Creates a new Monte Carlo simulation framework

Parameters:
multiFactorModel - The model that provides all the calculation to generate scenarios
evaluator - The object responsible for evaluating the derivative value and stop the simulation
randomVectorGenerator - A generator to feed the model with suitably distributed vectors
baseScenario - The starting point for the simulation
pointDates - The points that define the time horizon of the simulation
timeStep - The time step (fraction of year) to be used in the simulation
Method Detail

simulate

public int simulate()
This method executes a complete Monte Carlo simulation. It runs up to a maximum number of iterations by creating a new scenario, feeding it to the evaluator, and letting the evaluator determine if the simulation can stop

Returns:
The number of completed iterations
